title: I've started following the Player Behaviour Guidelines and the results are hilarious
body:
Some highlights from ONE game (Yes, that's four enemy team members you see)

1: ur bad
Crepevictim: bit rude calling me bad
Crepevictim: not very nice
1: you are f$^king trash dude
1: ooOOooOoO big scary boy with the report
1: run and tell Riot
1: tell em I fisted your dad

Crepevictim: I'm asking you to not be so rude please
Crepevictim: A reasonable request

Enemy number two starts joining in
2: little coward

And then out of nowhere, number three
3: rengar your sh*t

Number four joins in
4: noob rengar you are sh*t

More of the usual "scrub" talk followed by
1: hey Riot if you're reading this, I fisted rengars dad
2: ged good rengar and maybe you wont be so salty

Post game lobby I said thanks for the game guys I had fun
I did not swear once throughout the game, I simply asked them to stop being so rude
People will suggest muting. But my new goal is to purge the toxic players that I meet. I don't encourage them to be toxic other than being a positive player, but the more fuel they give the more likely they will get banned :)

replies.body: maybe it was a girl, you dont know.

Hey there,

Could you remove the offending summoners names from your post as naming and shaming is NOT allowed on the boards and will only result in your thread being deleted.

I filtered the names....they aren't the real summoner names...
But as requested. I just want these guys to actually receive punishment, they look like they do this every game.

Did you report them in the post-game screen? If not you can [submit a support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new) and they will forward the report on to the Player Behaviour team, however you won't receive any feedback on any punishment given as they're not allowed to release those details.

Yup, all four were reported. And when you say Player Behaviour team, you mean the automated system that determines if you get a chat restriction yeah? Because that one guy in particular (player #1) deserves more than that if you ask me

Oh ok that's good to know. So basically, if someone is being abusive and a punish, just let the system take care of it. But in extreme situations, rather than reporting I should send in a ticket for potentially harsher (and presumably more accurate) punishment?

I would recommend only sending a ticket in if you forget to report someone at post-game or if the offence occurs out of game (pvp.net chat).

The automated system works a lot better than you think.

Oh believe me, I know it works.
Works so well it doesn't take in any other factors other than "did you do the wrong thing" and if so, you got ban

The system doesn't discriminate. If you did something the system deems unacceptable then it will punish for it. It doesn't matter what instigates the behaviour or what other factors are in play, if you demonstrate inappropriate behaviour then the system will punish. Two wrongs don't make a right, and reacting to abuse with more abuse only makes double the abuse.

Basically, as far as the system is concerned, there aren't really any other factors that are relevant. The policy is basically, that kind of behaviour is unacceptable, regardless of reason.

That's the simplest way I can put it. Hopefully it addresses your concerns somewhat. Seph pretty much answered all your other questions but if you'd like to know anything else feel free to ask :)
